summary: Bug fix verified: Bulk-imported employee assets are now visible on the Assets page. All 9 backend tests passed. All UI tests passed. The Employee Assignments tab shows bulk-imported data correctly with all required columns.
passed_tests: Backend: Response has correct structure (total, records)
Backend: Record has all required fields (emp_code, employee_name, sdpl_number, tag, mobile_charger, laptop, system, printer, sim_mobile_no)
Backend: Bulk-imported data visible (EMP00001 - Test User with System=Yes, Printer=Yes)
Backend: Search with no results returns empty
Backend: Endpoint requires authentication (401 for unauthenticated)
Backend: Asset Inventory endpoint still works
UI: Assets page loads with data-testid='assets-page'
UI: Employee Assignments tab is visible and active by default for admins
UI: Table shows correct headers (Emp Code, Employee Name, SDPL Number, Tag, Mobile/Charger, Laptop, System, Printer, SIM/Mobile No)
UI: EMP00001 - Test User row visible with correct data
UI: System=Yes and Printer=Yes shown as green badges
UI: Search functionality works (filters by emp_code, employee_name)
UI: Empty state shown for non-existent search
UI: Asset Inventory tab works (shows 'No assets found')
UI: My Assets tab works (shows 'No assets assigned to you')
UI: My Requests tab works (shows 'No asset requests')
critical_code_review_comments: Backend routes/assets.py: GET /api/assets/employee-assignments endpoint correctly placed BEFORE /{asset_id} route to prevent path matching issues
Backend routes/assets.py: Endpoint reads from 'employee_assets' collection (populated by bulk import)
Frontend AssetsPage.js: Employee Assignments tab is default for admins (defaultValue='assignments')
Frontend AssetsPage.js: Table correctly displays all bulk import fields with Yes/No badges
seed_data_creation: None - using existing bulk-imported data (EMP00001 - Test User)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Bug fix verified: Bulk-imported employee assets are now visible on the Assets page. The fix added a new endpoint GET /api/assets/employee-assignments that reads from 'employee_assets' collection (populated by bulk import). Frontend has a new 'Employee Assignments' tab that displays this data. Test data: EMP00001 - Test User with System=Yes, Printer=Yes in employee_assets collection.
